demolition

Class Bomb

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.GameObject
      • demolition.Bomb

  • public class Bomb
extends GameObject
    The Bomb class determine where the bomb going to explode and how does the explosion impact on other GameObject such as wall and player

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Bomb.ExplosionDirection
      The ExplosionDirection enum has three direction that Bomb can impact on

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class demolition.GameObject

        sprite, x, y

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bomb

        public Bomb(int x,
            int y,
            int matrixX,
            int matrixY,
            Wall[][] wallMap,
            java.util.ArrayList<Player> enemyArrayList,
            BombGuy bombGuy)
        Constructor for Bomb
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the Bomb
        y - y-coordinate of the Bomb
        matrixX - the grid position x of the Bomb, it indicates which row the Bomb is in
        matrixY - the grid position y of the Bomb, it indicates which column the Bomb is in
        wallMap - the 2-D array that store all the wall object and its child
        enemyArrayList - the arrayList that store players that classify as enemies
        bombGuy - the BombGuy that placed the bomb
        See Also:
        Player, GameObject, Wall

      • blockExplosion

        public void blockExplosion(Bomb.ExplosionDirection direction,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        Animated the explosion on the wallMap, if there is solid or broken wall, animation stop. Destroy the broken wall upon explosion
        Parameters:
        direction - ExplosionDirection value to indicate which PImage should be used
        x - the pixel location of x-axis the explorsion should take placed
        y - the pixel location of y-axis the explorsion should take placed
